content:
• Wednesday, April 10, 2013
  • SHCAY

    Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY +9%) gains today after saying it's October-March operating profit will come...

    Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY +9%) gains today after saying it's October-March operating profit will come in well above forecasts. The company likely generated slightly more than ¥20B ($200M) in group operating profit in the October-March period, surpassing the standing projection of ¥13.8B, thanks to such factors as payroll cutbacks and increased sales of LCD panels to Samsung Electronics.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 PM
  • CEDC

    Central European Distribution (NASDAQ:CEDC) says its impaired creditors have voted...

    Central European Distribution (NASDAQ:CEDC) says its impaired creditors have voted overwhelmingly to accept a reorganization plan, giving the green light for the plan go before the Delaware Bankruptcy Court in May. If approved, CEDC says that Roust Trading will make an aggregate $5M payment to all existing stockholders in April. The financial restructuring should eliminate approximately $665.2M in debt from CEDC's and its related affiliates balance sheets. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) issues updated proof-of-concept results for its tumor treating...

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) issues updated proof-of-concept results for its tumor treating Disorazol Z cytotoxic conjugates, such as AEZS-125 and AEZS-138. The company says results showed the compounds have high potential for the treatment of luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone receptor positive tumors, particularly in human ovarian and endometrial cancer xenograft models. Shares +19% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM
  • DVOXQ

    DynaVox (DVOX) says that The NASDAQ Stock Market is delisting its shares, effective April 16. In...

    DynaVox (DVOX) says that The NASDAQ Stock Market is delisting its shares, effective April 16. In October, 2012, the company received a notice from Nasdaq indicating it was not in compliance with it's $1 minimum bid price requirement, and the delisting is the result of the DVOX's failure to regain compliance. The company doesn't plan appeal. Shares -10% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 PM
  • APOG

    More on Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG): Q4 misses across the board, despite posting higher...

    More on Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG): Q4 misses across the board, despite posting higher total sales Y/Y. Net profit rose 48% as the industrial-glass manufacturer posted improved results out of its architectural segment and stronger margins, which rose to 20.2% from 19.4%. For the current year, the company straddles Street estimates, forecasting per-share earnings of $0.90 to $1 on revenue growth in the high single digits. Analysts are looking for $0.97 a share and revenue growth of 7%. Shares -7.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM
  • AEZS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:45 p.m.: AEZS +29%. ZUMZ +10%. PCYG +4%. BLK +4%. MDU +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:45 p.m.: AEZS +29%. ZUMZ +10%. PCYG +4%. BLK +4%. MDU +3%.
    After-hours top losers: FTNT -15%. APOG -7%. EQIX -4%. FIRE -4%. YUM -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS) +2.5% AH after Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) submits what it calls its "best and...

    MetroPCS (PCS) +2.5% AH after Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) submits what it calls its "best and final offer" for merging the prepaid carrier with T-Mobile USA. The new offer reduces the combined company's debt by $3.8B to $11.2B, cuts the interest rate on the debt by 50 bps, and extends the lockup on DT's stake in the company by 6 months to 18 months. The proposed ownership structure remains the same - DT would own 74% of the company, and MetroPCS shareholders 26%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) falls after the bell as the company says China same-store sales fell 13%...

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) falls after the bell as the company says China same-store sales fell 13% in March after renewed avian flu fears caused KFC revenues in the region to dip 16%. The company says it will continue to "educate consumers that properly cooked chicken is perfectly safe to eat." Shares -2.64% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    PC-exposed names trade lower AH in response to IDC's bleak Q1 data. HPQ -1.8% AH. MSFT -1%. INTC...

    PC-exposed names trade lower AH in response to IDC's bleak Q1 data. HPQ -1.8% AH. MSFT -1%. INTC -1.3%. Will the numbers give Michael Dell and Silver Lake more ammo to justify their $13.65/share LBO offer?
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • CHFS

    Sunshine Heart (SSH) announces a public offering of its common stock, with a 30-day...

    Sunshine Heart (SSH) announces a public offering of its common stock, with a 30-day underwriter-option to purchase up to an additional 15% for overallotments. The size and terms of the offering were not disclosed. Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, including its ongoing clinical trial and product development activities. Shares -5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) moves higher in late trading after saying net sales hit $61M in March...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) moves higher in late trading after saying net sales hit $61M in March compared to $50.9M during the same five-week period last year, representing a nearly 20% Y/Y gain. Comps rose 2.1% last month. Shares +8.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) -13.5% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $134M-$136M and EPS of...

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) -13.5% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $134M-$136M and EPS of $0.10, below a consensus of $140.4M and $0.12. Billings are pegged at $147M-$149M, below guidance of $158M-$162M. The company blames a failure to close a few U.S. service provider deals (F5's warning also cited telco demand), EMEA/Latin America weakness, and inventory shortages and product timing issues. Asia-Pac and U.S. enterprise demand was healthy. With shares trading at 36x 2013E EPS, there wasn't much room for error. Did Ken Goldman's departure play a role? CC at 5PM ET (webcast). CHKP -1.3%. PANW -0.8%. FIRE -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • APOG

    Apogee Enterpr (NASDAQ:APOG): FQ4 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $179.7M (+7% Y/Y)...

    Apogee Enterpr (NASDAQ:APOG): FQ4 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $179.7M (+7% Y/Y) misses by $0.26M. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.1%) is closing with a solid gain after the WSJ reported Deutsche Telekom...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.1%) is closing with a solid gain after the WSJ reported Deutsche Telekom is preparing a higher bid for prepaid rival MetroPCS. Leap, which had 45.4% of its float shorted as of March 15 (that's actually down from late-2012 levels), has often risen and fallen on M&A speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • ROYL

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +44.5%) shares soar on news that an undisclosed company agreed in...

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +44.5%) shares soar on news that an undisclosed company agreed in principle to fund $38M in exploration costs for seismic data acquisition and the drilling of two horizontal wells at its 96K Alaska North Slope holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • MEG

    Lin TV (TVL +11.6%) ramps higher after saying it has acquired a majority stake in...

    Lin TV (TVL +11.6%) ramps higher after saying it has acquired a majority stake in California-based digital marketer Dedicated Media which, according to Lin's senior VP, "has the ability to deliver the right ads to the right users at the right times." Nothing wrong with that. (Previously: Lin acquires HYFN)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENV

    Envestnet (ENV +9.3%) posts strong gains a day after Stifel Nicolaus (who has the stock at Buy)...

    Envestnet (ENV +9.3%) posts strong gains a day after Stifel Nicolaus (who has the stock at Buy) increases its price target on the shares from $19 to $20. 

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • AIG

    It looks as if the court has approved AIG's (AIG +0.9%) $115M settlement with ex-chairman Hank...

    It looks as if the court has approved AIG's (AIG +0.9%) $115M settlement with ex-chairman Hank Greenberg. Earlier today, the company asked a court to block the former CEO's efforts to sue the government, warning it could cause a backlash and harm business. Greenberg is suing the government on AIG]'s behalf, claiming the company was unfairly compensated during the government's bailout.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +2.4%) CEO Maria das Gracas Foster denies that Brazil's government has ordered it...

    Petrobras (PBR +2.4%) CEO Maria das Gracas Foster denies that Brazil's government has ordered it to help billionaire Eike Batista's troubled EBX Group out of its financial pickle but confirms PBR has discussed using a liquefied natural gas terminal that could potentially be developed at the Acu port under construction by Batista's LLX Logistica.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • JCI

    Johnson Controls (JCI +2%) moves up on speculation the company is likely to get the first round...

    Johnson Controls (JCI +2%) moves up on speculation the company is likely to get the first round of bids for its auto electronics unit over the next week. Investors learned JCI was exploring a sale in March, after it hired JPMorgan to explore the divestiture. The company is hoping to get $1B for the unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +6.8%) shoots higher as an ITC administrative law judge grants a 3 business day...

    VirnetX (VHC +6.8%) shoots higher as an ITC administrative law judge grants a 3 business day extension (to April 15) for VirnetX and Apple to "reach a written agreement" regarding an Apple motion for sanctions in their IP dispute. VirnetX stated in February it plans to withdraw its ITC complaint against Apple, after a $368.2M verdict in a Texas suit was upheld.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM

  • Gold futures fell nearly $28/oz. in their biggest one-day percentage loss since November...

    Gold futures fell nearly $28/oz. in their biggest one-day percentage loss since November following the surprise early release of the FOMC Minutes and Goldman's cut of gold forecasts through 2014; a stronger dollar index also weighed. Goldman says gold could fall faster and larger than its forecast if ETF owners keep exiting, which is happening today: GLD -1.5%, IAU -1.5%, GDX -3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 9 Comments
  • TRIP

    Online travel stocks are rallying with more investors jumping on board as both fundamental and...

    Online travel stocks are rallying with more investors jumping on board as both fundamental and technical factors for the sector start to look more promising. In the group, TripAdvisor (TRIP +2.6%) has the business model most leveraged to online advertising rates while Priceline (PCLN +2.8%) has been tagged as "best in breed." Growth opportunities in new markets is the headline story for sector stalwarts Expedia (EXPE +2.5%), Kayak (KYAK +1.3%), Orbitz Worldwide (OWW +8.4%), and Travelzoo (TZOO +2.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • DUK

    Duke Energy (DUK +0.8%) moves up today after saying earlier that it's acquired two commercial...

    Duke Energy (DUK +0.8%) moves up today after saying earlier that it's acquired two commercial solar power projects near Twentynine Palms, California from project developer SolarWorld. The twin projects, named Highlander Solar 1 and 2, will be run as a single operation and collectively generate 21 megawatts of renewable energy, enough to power more than 4,000 average homes each year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL +7%) spikes higher after Wellington Management discloses it had a 13.9% passive...

    UniPixel (UNXL +7%) spikes higher after Wellington Management discloses it had a 13.9% passive stake in the touchscreen film maker as of March 31, up from a prior 5.1%. Shares have risen 33% from their April 2 intraday low, after falling 35% from their March 28 intraday high. (13G)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • HRB

    H&R Block (HRB +2.4%) rallies after Webush starts coverage with an Outperform and $33 PT....

    H&R Block (HRB +2.4%) rallies after Webush starts coverage with an Outperform and $33 PT. The firm touts H&R's "strong position in the assisted and online tax preparation markets," thinks the Affordable Care Act could lead to higher revenue/filing, and sees potential for the company's reloadable prepaid card business.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +4%) posts a gain this morning after Chardan Capital Markets starts...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +4%) posts a gain this morning after Chardan Capital Markets starts the shares with a Buy rating and a price target of $80 a share. The firm is taking a much more aggressive stance than Canaccord yesterday, who initiated the shares with a Hold and a modest $55 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • DTEGY

    Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) is "reviewing a sweeter bid" for MetroPCS (PCS +3.8%) and could...

    Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) is "reviewing a sweeter bid" for MetroPCS (PCS +3.8%) and could announce the terms as soon as today, the WSJ reports. Many have been expecting a higher offer to arrive since shareholder advisory firm ISS joined Paulson & Co and disgruntled MetroPCS shareholders in opposing the current deal. Bloomberg notes DT is able to monitor shareholder voting in real-time, giving it a chance to adjust its offer if it looks like the current bid will fail. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • JKS

    Many solar stocks are giving back some of yesterday's monumental First Solar-driven gains. A...

    Many solar stocks are giving back some of yesterday's monumental First Solar-driven gains. A weak Q4 report from JinkoSolar (JKS -5%) is a likely factor: in addition to soundly missing estimates, Jinko reported a gross margin of just 3.8% (-200 bps Q/Q and +820 bps Y/Y), and guided for Q1 module shipments to fall to 270MW-300MW from Q4's 301.9MW. YGE -7.4%. SOL -6.2%. LSK -4.5%. CSUN -2%. LDK -4.5%. TSL -1.6%. SunPower (SPWR -2.7%) is lower in spite of receiving an upgrade to Buy from S&P.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +11.1%) brightens as Piper Jaffray upgrades the shares to Overweight...

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +11.1%) brightens as Piper Jaffray upgrades the shares to Overweight citing survey data which analyst Stephanie Wissink says validates the company's "strategic execution as a lifestyle and fashion retailer." PSUN should experience "sustained market share improvement" and its "timeline to profitability" should accelerate going forward. Price target: $3 from $2.50. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • MRK

    Jim Cramer likes what he sees in Merck (MRK +2.1%) right now, saying the stock is lagging its...

    Jim Cramer likes what he sees in Merck (MRK +2.1%) right now, saying the stock is lagging its peers, trading at just about 12x earnings versus a richer 14x the rest of the sector. Patent cliff fears for this stock are pretty well mitigated, Cramer says. The company has no fewer than five solid drugs in development, and while none may be a home run, the pipeline should bolster growth over the next few years. He thinks the stock should be trading somewhere closer $60 right now.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -0.4%) underperforms after Evercore starts coverage with an Underweight and $115...

    Netflix (NFLX -0.4%) underperforms after Evercore starts coverage with an Underweight and $115 PT. The firm thinks the launch of Intel's Web TV service will lead to higher programming costs and less pricing power. Intel's service is being pitched as an alternative to traditional pay-TV services rather than a direct Netflix rival, and will undoubtedly cost much more than the $8/month charged for Netflix.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU +5.2%) is among the standouts in today's tech rally. An upgrade to Buy from Hong...

    Baidu (BIDU +5.2%) is among the standouts in today's tech rally. An upgrade to Buy from Hong Kong-based 86Research could be helping. Shares remain down 11% YTD and 38% over the last 12 months, as concerns about mobile monetization and competition from Qihoo/Sohu continue to weigh.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • HBIO

    Harvard Bioscience (HBIO -15%) postpones a planned IPO of its regenerative medicine device...

    Harvard Bioscience (HBIO -15%) postpones a planned IPO of its regenerative medicine device subsidiary, citing unfavorable market conditions. The company says the spinoff will maximize shareholder value by separating the unit from its profitable core business. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • GRA

    W.R. Grace (GRA -2.3%) slips today after slashing its earnings view for the year and saying that...

    W.R. Grace (GRA -2.3%) slips today after slashing its earnings view for the year and saying that Q1 preliminary earnings would come in below Street expectations, as the specialty chemical company reels from a weak environment in Europe. For Q1, the company expects its EPS to come in between $0.80 - $0.81. Analysts were looking for an EPS of $0.88. For the current year, it now expects revenue to be around $665M to $685M, down from its prior view of $685M to $ 705M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • SYNC

    Volatile Synacor (SYNC +9.7%) is among the day's big winners. This morning, the company issued a...

    Volatile Synacor (SYNC +9.7%) is among the day's big winners. This morning, the company issued a PR boasting of strong uptake for its Cloud ID Social Login solution, which allows TV Everywhere users to log in via Facebook, Twitter, or Google. Shares remain down 47% YTD, and far below last summer's Jonathan Lebed-fueled highs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -0.7%) leg down again today, extending yesterday's slide stemming from...

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -0.7%) leg down again today, extending yesterday's slide stemming from KPMG's resignation as its auditor and firing the partner in charge of auditing the company's books on allegations of insider trading. However, in stark contrast, Skechers (SKX +1.7%) - the other company caught up in KPMG's fiasco - shrugged off the news to gain 1.7% yesterday and is up again today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • OKE

    ONEOK Partners (OKS -1.7%) is cut to Sell at Goldman Sachs, which believes natural gas price and...

    ONEOK Partners (OKS -1.7%) is cut to Sell at Goldman Sachs, which believes natural gas price and spread headwinds will weigh on earnings in its gathering and processing and natural liquids segments, driving distribution growth below the group average vs. a recent history of above-average growth. The firm also sees risk of further equity dilution given OKS's large capex program and high leverage.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • MSM

    MSC Industrial (MSM -3.7%) skips the market rally today after its FQ2 missed top line consensus...

    MSC Industrial (MSM -3.7%) skips the market rally today after its FQ2 missed top line consensus estimates earlier. Net earnings fell 6.6% Y/Y as higher operating costs and weaker margins offset modest revenue growth. The company also forecast its FQ3 to come in below estimates due to soft demand and a lack of midyear price adjustments. It now expects to earn around $0.95 to $0.99 per share, on revenue of $597M to $609M The Street was looking for $1.10 on $633M, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • FDO

    Heard during Family Dollar's (FDO -0.4%) earnings call: 1) The retailer leans on the typical...

    Heard during Family Dollar's (FDO -0.4%) earnings call: 1) The retailer leans on the typical excuses of higher gas prices and payroll tax hikes in explaining somewhat lean consumer spending trends. Sales of consumables and food were better than the home and apparel categories. 2) Execs note inventories are "clean" as the company heads into the spring and summer selling season. 3) A long-term goal of 5%-7% growth in square footage is set as Family Dollar remains on track to open 500 new stores in FY13. 4) The biggest takeaway could be that FDO expects consumers to remain constrained with discretionary spending this year. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • ADTN

    Adtran's (ADTN +13%) Q1 beat is contributing to strong gains in telecom equipment, chip, and...

    Adtran's (ADTN +13%) Q1 beat is contributing to strong gains in telecom equipment, chip, and component stocks, as investors take it as another sign of improving telecom capex going into earnings season. Adtran's remarks about strong demand from both U..S. and international carriers can't be hurting. CSCO +2.5%. CIEN +6.4%. JDSU +4.6%. ALU +4.6%. FN +4.8%. FNSR +6%. PKT +4.2%. RKUS +4.2%. JNPR +3.9%. CAVM +3%. INFN +2.9%. OCLR +4%. SONS +2.5%. 2013 has seen a string of rallies (I, II, III) tied to capex hopes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • THC

    In addition to Deutsche's downgrade of Tenet Healthcare (THC -4.7%), the firm also cuts Health...

    In addition to Deutsche's downgrade of Tenet Healthcare (THC -4.7%), the firm also cuts Health Management (HMA -16.5%) and Community Health (CYH -4.8%) to Hold as well, citing pumped-up share prices due to overzealous investor enthusiasm for the US health-care overhaul.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • CHDN

    Churchill Downs (CHDN +4.9%) trades higher after Janney Capital initiates coverage on the...

    Churchill Downs (CHDN +4.9%) trades higher after Janney Capital initiates coverage on the entertainment concern with a Buy rating and $84 price target. A move by the company to buy a casino in Maine has been catching some attention as it increases Churchill's exposure to the gaming side of its business.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3.9%) rallies as Home receives positive (but generally not glowing) reviews....

    Facebook (FB +3.9%) rallies as Home receives positive (but generally not glowing) reviews. Though not crazy about the lack of folders (they're replaced with app pages) and widgets, The Verge's Dieter Bohn is a fan of Home's Cover Feed and Chat Heads. "I find it very telling that even this infrequent Facebook user found himself interacting with status updates instead of doing other stuff." In spite of some reservations, Walt Mossberg calls Home "easy to use, elegantly designed and addictive." Facebook says it wants Home to eventually support feeds from Twitter and other services.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 8 Comments
  • KMX

    Shares of CarMax (KMX +4%) gain on better than anticipated Q4 revenue. Net earnings rose 13% Y/Y...

    Shares of CarMax (KMX +4%) gain on better than anticipated Q4 revenue. Net earnings rose 13% Y/Y on strong sales in its used-vehicle and wholesale segments as well a 15% jump in income growth at its finance unit. Total used-vehicle sales volume grew by 12% over the year ago period, while same-store unit sales rose 6%, despite one less selling day in the latest quarter. Wholesale unit sales were up 7%, with average selling prices up 4.3% overall.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • BGMD

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +3.6%) trades up after announcing earlier that partner Abbott (ABT +0.2%)...

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +3.6%) trades up after announcing earlier that partner Abbott (ABT +0.2%) has obtained a CE Mark for its Galectin-3 assay run on the Architect immunochemistry platform. The Galectin-3 assay is an indicator that assesses the risk for readmission in heart failure. OTC:BGMD is partnering with four diagnostic instrument manufacturers to commercialize automated versions of the test, making it available in several European countries, pending country registration.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • AGEN

    Agenus (AGEN +4.1%) trades higher early after announcing Orin Bloch, clinical instructor in the...

    Agenus (AGEN +4.1%) trades higher early after announcing Orin Bloch, clinical instructor in the Department of Neurological Surgery at the University of California San Francisco, will present data on the company's brain cancer vaccine at the American Association of Neurological Surgeon's annual meeting this month. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -4.4%) remains in an acquisitive mood: the company has followed up on...

    First Solar (FSLR -4.4%) remains in an acquisitive mood: the company has followed up on yesterday's purchase of TetraSun by acquiring a 60MW California solar project. Construction is expected to begin in 2014, and finish in 2015. Shares are lower as investors take profits and analysts throw cold water in the wake of yesterday's huge rally. Raymond James (Market Perform) argues the cost advantage for First Solar's thin-film modules "appears to be gone for good." It should be noted only one firm - Citi - rated First Solar a buy going into yesterday. (150MW project purchase)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • WPM

    Early weakness in Silver Wheaton (SLW -3.3%) is attributed to reports that a Chilean court...

    Early weakness in Silver Wheaton (SLW -3.3%) is attributed to reports that a Chilean court suspended Barrick Gold's (ABX -4.8%) Pascua-Lama project. In addition to being a key growth asset for ABX, Pascua-Lama enhances SLW's long-term growth profile and is a cornerstone asset for years to come, Briefing.com says. SLW's 25% share of the estimated annual silver production for the first five years is 9M oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • MTL

    Mechel OAO (MTL +6.2%) refinances liabilities due in 2013 with a new $1.3B loan agreement. The...

    Mechel OAO (MTL +6.2%) refinances liabilities due in 2013 with a new $1.3B loan agreement. The deal with VTB Bank "significantly improves the group's debt structure," CFO Stanislav Ploschenko says. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • TMHC

    Homebuilder Taylor Morrison (NYSE:TMHC) +7.4% to $23.62 on its debut on the NYSE after it raised...

    Homebuilder Taylor Morrison (NYSE:TMHC) +7.4% to $23.62 on its debut on the NYSE after it raised $629.2M in its IPO. The company sold 28.6M shares at $22 each, the top end of the expected range of $20-22. The size of the IPO was increased from 23.8M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (DRWI +8.4%) rises after saying it will remain Nokia's (NOK +1.3%) preferred supplier...

    DragonWave (DRWI +8.4%) rises after saying it will remain Nokia's (NOK +1.3%) preferred supplier of packet microwave products. Under a new framework, the company will receive an "immediate cash payment" of €10.6M which will eliminate an existing receivable on its balance sheet. DRWI also says it has cut senior management positions by a third as part of its cost reduction effort. The shares are off sharply YTD after the company cut its Q4 sales outlook in March. 

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • DECK

    A survey of teenagers conducted by Piper Jaffray finds the Deckers Outdoor's (DECK +3%) Ugg...

    A survey of teenagers conducted by Piper Jaffray finds the Deckers Outdoor's (DECK +3%) Ugg brand still resonates with upper-income teens. Though remaining on the sidelines on the moment with a Neutral rating, the firm took its price target on DECK up to $48 and raised profit estimates with Ugg seemingly still on trend.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 2 Comments
